Group: Lessons learned from mistakes and experiences
Items: I made a mistake that lead to a breakdown on some internal service during an internship. I learned that testing is important in real life.

Group: Lessons learned from mistakes and experiences
Items: When my code got deployed, it broke the program, meaning nobody could sign up for shifts. I needed to validate the results of my code.

Group: Lessons learned from mistakes and experiences
Items: I learned that being over zealous and volunteering can not only harm me, but could be a huge inconvenience to others as well.

Group: Lessons learned from mistakes and experiences
Items: I should not make commitments that drain me and leave me without sleep because I end up not being present, and it is unhealthy.
I learned that there are scenarios where some apparently less efficient solutions are actually more efficient and should be kept in mind.
I learned that the simplest can sometimes beat the most innovative. I strive to build solutions that are better suited for the end user.
Regardless of how well I manage my time, I would still have a limited number of things that I could commit to and do well in.
Wrong about how I should manage my time abroad-focused on schoolwork-wished made more friends and explored and traveled more.
Didn't really know what computer programming actually was but I thought I would hate it. Ended up loving the class and realizing I love CS.

Group: Importance of user control in UI design
Items: One of the most valued characteristics of a good UI is letting people have as much control as possible, so as to satisfy all user groups.
